meanings.definition: The quality or state of being cellular.
meanings.sent1: The cellularities of the plant tissue were visible under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the cellularities of different organisms to understand their structures.
meanings.sent3: The cellularities of the sponge made it look like a tiny city under the sea.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the cellularities of the leaf as inspiration for a unique painting.
meanings.sent5: The cellularities of the honeycomb were intricate and fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: The presence of cells in a structure or organism.
meanings.sent1: The cellularities of the blood sample were analyzed in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The cellularities of the human body play a crucial role in maintaining health.
meanings.sent3: The cellularities of the beehive were carefully organized by the bees.
meanings.sent4: The cellularities of the city were compared to a bustling network of communication.
meanings.sent5: The cellularities of the tree bark provided protection and support for the tree.
